brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to investigate the possible association between low levels of
      MBL and the development of endometriosis

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Polymorphisms of Mannan-binding Lectin (MBL)and Serum Levels of MBL in Patients With Endometriosis

detailed_description.textblock:
Endometriosis is a chronic, inflammatory disease, affecting approximately 10% of the female
      population. The pathogenesis of endometriosis is still unclear, but several studies have
      indicated that the immune system is involved. It has been suggested that endometriosis
      should be considered an autoimmune disease, considering the findings of elevated levels of
      cytokines, decreased cell apoptosis, increased incidence of autoantibodies and a higher
      frequency of other autoimmune diseases in endometriosis patients. MBL participates in the
      innate immune defence by activating complement on the surfaces of microorganisms, but
      several studies have suggested that MBL is also involved in autoimmune diseases. The
      individual MBL level is highly variable due to a number of polymorphic sites in the
      structural gene and in the promoter region, and approximately 12 % of the normal population
      have very low serum MBL levels (<100 ng/ml).

      The possible association between MBL and endometriosis has been investigated in two small
      studies, in which no association was found. The aim of the present study is to investigate
      the prevalence of individuals with low serum levels of MBL and with genotypes associated
      with low MBL production in a larger group of endometriosis patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  histologically verified endometriosis

          -  ASRM stage 2-4

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pregnancy

          -  actual treatment with GnRh analog

          -  autoimmune diseases

study_pop.textblock: Endometriosis patients referred to the endometriosis clinic at Aarhus University Hospital

facility.name: Aarhus University Hospital, Department of Gynecology and Obstetrics

clinical_study.official_title: Genetic Polymorphisms of Mannan-binding Lectin (MBL) and Serum Levels of MBL in Patients With Endometriosis

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Regional Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of individuals with s-MBL < 100 ng/ml
Frequency of individuals with MBL genotypes LXPA/O or O/O

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

results_reference.citation: Kavoussi SK, Mueller MD, Lebovic DI. Expression of mannose-binding lectin in the peritoneal fluid of women with and without endometriosis. Fertil Steril. 2006 May;85(5):1526-8. Epub 2006 Apr 5.
Ozerkan K, Oral B, Uncu G. Mannose-binding lectin levels in endometriosis. Fertil Steril. 2010 Jul;94(2):775-6. Epub 2009 Nov 14.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
